ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans or pinto beans, drained and rinsed
steps: Season steak with taco seasoning, rubbing it in well. Let sit for 5-10 minutes at room temperature.

Heat olive oil in a skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Cook steak 5-6 minutes, flipping halfway through, until medium (internal temp 135-140°F). Remove and let rest 10 minutes, then slice thinly against the grain.

While steak rests, prepare beans. For refried beans: warm in a small pan or microwave until spreadable. For seasoned whole beans: heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat, add minced garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant. Add drained beans, cumin, chili powder, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally and lightly mashing some beans with the back of a spoon. Add squeeze of lime juice and remove from heat.
Slice telera rolls in half horizontally. Lightly toast cut sides in a dry skillet over medium heat until golden and slightly crisp, about 2-3 minutes.
Spread refried beans on bottom half of each roll. Add a thin layer of mayonnaise or crema on top half.
Layer sliced steak on the beans, followed by cheese, tomato slices, avocado, red onion, and lettuce.
Top with pickled jalapeños, fresh cilantro, and salsa or hot sauce to taste. Close sandwiches and press gently.
Cut each torta in half with a sharp knife and serve immediately while bread is still crisp.
title: Torta de Carne Asada
